content:
No worries about the mistake!

Excellent insight about tensing up when playing the tremolo pattern! Relaxation and finger independence are crucial for a smooth, even tremolo. 

Practicing with a drone or metronome is an excellent idea! Using a drone can help you develop a sense of pitch and tone, while a metronome will help you maintain a consistent rhythm. Here's a suggestion:

* Start by practicing the tremolo pattern with a metronome set to a slow tempo (around 40-60 BPM). Focus on playing each note in time, with a consistent tone and rhythm.
* Once you feel comfortable with the rhythm, try adding a drone to the metronome. You can use a digital tuner or a phone app to generate a drone at the desired pitch. This will help you develop your sense of pitch and tone while playing the tremolo pattern.
* As you become more comfortable, gradually increase the tempo and experiment with different drone pitches to challenge your sense of pitch and tone.

Remember to practice slowly and deliberately, focusing on control and tone rather than speed. With consistent practice, you'll develop a beautiful, consistent tremolo that will enhance your overall playing.
